Attribute.Value: This kit of texts and materials for the culminating algebra and geometry course of the PASSPORT series, developed for middle schools, is designed with the goals of helping students to recognize and appreciate the role mathematics plays in the real world, to demonstrate the connections between mathematical topics, and to bridge students' understanding of mathematics from the concrete to the abstract. The use of color-coded examples and visual models, discovery-based learning activities, and investigations that encourage exploration and support conceptional understanding are intended to make the mathematics concepts accessible to students of various ability levels and learning styles. Each lesson demonstrates a mathematical skill that is then shown in a real world application. Each chapter begins with a chapter project connected to everyday life and/or other disciplines, which is developed through extension exercises throughout the chapter. Each chapter also includes: a technology extension activity that highlights how computers or calculators are used in real-life problem solving situations, an interview that focuses on how people use mathematics in their careers or an extension activity connecting mathematics to another discipline, and a communicating about mathematics activity.
